From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To allow slave Versatile Interface Processor (VIP) cards to log important error messages to the console, use the **service slave-log** command in global configuration mode. To disable slave logging, use the **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: This commmand has no arguments or keywords.

Examples: In the following example, the router is configured to log important messages from the slave cards to the console:
The following is sample output generated when this command is enabled:
IPC-2-NOMEM: No memory available for IPC system initialization
The first line indicates which slot sent the message. The second line contains the error message.
ExtraInfo: This command allows slave slots to log error messages of level 2 or higher (critical, alerts, and emergencies).
